react4j.arez

Class ReactArezComponent<P extends BaseProps,C extends BaseContext>

  • java.lang.Object
    • react4j.core.Component<P,BaseState,C>
      • react4j.arez.ReactArezComponent<P,C>

  • public abstract class ReactArezComponent<P extends BaseProps,C extends BaseContext>
extends Component<P,BaseState,C>
    A base class for all Arez enabled components. This class makes the component rendering reactive and it will schedule a re-render any time any of the observable entities accessed within the scope of the render method are changed.

    To achieve this goal, the props and state of the component are converted into observable properties. This of course means they must be accessed within the scope of an Arez transaction. (Typically this means it needs to be accessed within the scope of a Action annotated method or within the scope of the render method.

      • shouldComponentUpdate

        protected boolean shouldComponentUpdate(@Nullable
                                        P nextProps,
                                        @Nullable
                                        BaseState nextState,
                                        @Nullable
                                        C nextContext)
        Use this method to let React know if a component's output is not affected by the current change in state or props. The default behavior is to re-render on every state change, and in the vast majority of cases you should rely on the default behavior. See the React Component documentation for more details.

        This method is invoked before rendering when new props or state are being received. This method is not called for the initial render or when Component.scheduleRender(boolean)} is called with the force parameter set to true.

        Returning false does not prevent child components from re-rendering when their state changes.

        If this method returns false, then Component.componentWillUpdate(BaseProps, BaseState, BaseContext), Component.render(), and Component.componentDidUpdate(BaseProps, BaseState) will not be invoked. In the future React may treat this method as a hint rather than a strict directive, and returning false may still result in a re-rendering of the component.

        Overrides:
        shouldComponentUpdate in class Component<P extends BaseProps,BaseState,C extends BaseContext>
        Parameters:
        nextProps - the new properties of the component.
        nextState - the new state of the component.
        nextContext - the new context of the component.
        Returns:
        true if the component should be updated.

      • componentDidMount

        protected void componentDidMount()
        This method is invoked after a component is attached to the DOM. Initialization that requires DOM nodes should go here. Setting state in this method will trigger a re-rendering. See the React Component documentation for more details.
        Overrides:
        componentDidMount in class Component<P extends BaseProps,BaseState,C extends BaseContext>

      • componentDidUpdate

        protected void componentDidUpdate(@Nullable
                                  P prevProps,
                                  @Nullable
                                  BaseState prevState)
        This method is invoked immediately after updating occurs. If you need to interact with the DOM after the component has been updated. See the React Component documentation for more details.
        Overrides:
        componentDidUpdate in class Component<P extends BaseProps,BaseState,C extends BaseContext>
        Parameters:
        prevProps - the props before the component was updated.
        prevState - the state before the component was updated.

      • componentWillUnmount

        protected void componentWillUnmount()
        This method is invoked immediately before a component is unmounted and destroyed. Perform any necessary cleanup in this method, such as invalidating timers, canceling network requests, or cleaning up any DOM elements that were created in Component.componentDidMount() See the React Component documentation for more details.
        Overrides:
        componentWillUnmount in class Component<P extends BaseProps,BaseState,C extends BaseContext>
